intro: Stachytarpheta ajugifolia, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower clusters that appear in late summer and persist into autumn. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Stachytarpheta ajugifolia is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators.
